creator: j0rd411@freenet.de
summary: Cannot load any webpage after 3-10 suspends (to RAM)

assigned_to_detail.name: nobody@mozilla.org
assigned_to_detail.real_name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/65.0.3325.181 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce:

Start Firefox (regardless of mode/addons/plugins), load at least one page, suspend. Repeat last step at least 3 times. 
Additional info: 
Firefox Version: 58.0.2. Bug first appeared in 57.
OS:  openSUSE Leap 42.3, Linux 4.4.104-39-default


Actual results:

After at most 10 wake ups opening any webpage is impossible (Unable to connect). The only workaround is closing the application and starting anew. 


Expected results:

Load the page correctly (as with e.g. Chromium)
comments.author: j0rd411@freenet.de

comments.text:
Hi J0rd411,

Given the fact that the issue is not reproducible in Firefox Release 56, could you please try to find a regression range using Mozregression tool?
Information on the tool is available at http://mozilla.github.io/mozregression/. Please don't hesitate to contact us if you encounter any problems.
comments.author: ciprian.muresan@softvision.ro

comments.text:
Marking this as Resolved - Incomplete due to the lack of response from the reporter.
If anyone can still reproduce it on the latest versions, feel free to reopen the issue and provide more information.
comments.author: ciprian.muresan@softvision.ro

cc_detail.name: ciprian.muresan@softvision.ro
cc_detail.real_name: Ciprian Muresan [:cmuresan], the awesome team of Test Pilot QA, :steve
